document.docAuthor: Volynkin, Anton V., Matov, Alexei Yu., Behounek, Gottfried & Han, Hui-Lin
document.docTitle: Mniotype dubiosa subsp. dubiosa A. Bang-Haas 1912
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Palaearctic Mniotype adusta (Esper, 1790) species-group with description of a new species and six new subspecies (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Palaearctic Mniotype adusta (Esper, 1790) species-group with description of a new species and six new subspecies (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae)

heading.emphasis:
Mniotype dubiosa dubiosa (A. Bang-Haas, 1912 )
stat. n.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hadena lama
var. dubiosa A. Bang-Haas, 1912
, Deutsche Entomologische Zeitschrift Iris
26
: 149 ( Type locality: „Mustagata Yarkend“ [NW China , Xinjiang, Keng Tau Mts, Muztagh ata Mt.]).

Type material examined. Lectotype .
Designated herein for
Hadena lama
var. dubiosa
: male, “Mustagata Yarkend” (printed) / “
Hadena Lama Stgr.
v.
Dubiosa
BH” (handwriten) / “B.H. 16 ” (handwriten) / “Preparation № MB. 355 Ch . Boursin” / pink label “Origin.” (printed) / (the lectotype deposited in coll NKMB ).
Paralectotype
: female, „Mus-tag-ata Yarkend“ (printed) / “
Hadena lama dubiosa
” (handwriten) / pink label “Origin.” (printed), slide Behounek 7659 f (deposited in coll NKMB ).

Slides AV0680, AV0685, AV0693, AV0694, AV0695, AV0704, AV0714, AV0715, AV0807, AV 1123 Volynkin (males), AV0716, AV0878 Volynkin, OP 2299 f, OP 2300 f Pekarsky (females).

Note . Previous authors have treated
dubiosa
as a subspecies (
Hacker & Peks 1990
;
Ronkay et al. 2001
) or a synonym (Hacker 1990 ) of
M. lama
. Study of the type material demonstrates its specific status.

Diagnosis . Wingspan 37–40 mm . Head, thorax and abdomen brown. Ground colour of forewing brown. Outer margin of reniform dentate. Medial area shadowed around claviform and medial fascia. Terminal area dark brown. Hindwing pale brown. This species is externally close to
M. juldussica
, but differs in the less dentate submarginal line, darker and more monotonous colouration of forewing and less expressed pattern. The correct determination of pale or damaged specimens often requires the study of the genitalia. The male genitalia of
M. dubiosa
(
Figs 81, 82
,
95
) differ clearly from those of
M. juldussica
in the narrower juxta with shorter serrated parts of its apical processes (in
M. juldussica
distal half, but in
M. dubiosa
only distal third serrate), narrower clavus strongly protruding from surface of sacculus, shorter ampulla, more rounded and apically elongated cucullus, obtuse and strongly dentate apical part of carina, shorter and less sclerotised eversible dorso-lateral bar of carina arising from the apical part of carina, and larger band of spinules on terminal diverticulum. The female genitalia (
Figs 117, 118
) differ in the narrower ostium bursae, narrower and less curved ductus bursae, weakly sclerotised appendix bursae and posterior part of corpus bursae, larger conical anterior projection of anterior part of corpus bursae and smaller signum.
Distribution . Central Asian. East (Saur and Tarbagatai Mts) and South-East Kazakhstan , Tien Shan massif, Pamir and Alai Mts, nortwestern China (Xinjiang).
